website_summaries.verdict: Professional-quality zester with super sharp grating edges that provides a narrow grating surface for precision zesting.
pros: The durable construction stays sharp to enable smooth zesting
It's easy to store and comes with a convenient plastic cover to prevent it from getting dull in your kitchen drawer
Easy to clean and won't rust
cons: Some find it a little too long

customer_reviews.title: Reduced quality from past versions or counterfeit
customer_reviews.text: I have had one of these for years and it's gotten dull so I ordered this to replace it. The new one even though it's the same "microplane" brand has a hard, cheap plastic handle compared to the soft rubber handle of before. Also the new one doesn't have the rubber grip at the bottom to rest against your cutting board without slipping. And it was missing the sheath. Both the rubber bottom and sheath were listed in the feature details so I'm sending this back. It might be counterfeit to the microplane brand.
customer_reviews.author: Koquelicot

customer_reviews.title: Inferior materials and difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: This Microplane is pathetic. It is flimsy, the inside edges are sharper than they should be and will easily cut your finger if you are cleaning out the inside and the grating teeth are recessed resulting in a less effective and more difficult grating process. I was replacing an existing Microplane and this is far inferior to my existing one. DO NOT BUY THIS. Upgrade to a better quality. If you have used a similar grater in the past, I promise, you will be unhappy with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Jamison

customer_reviews.title: COUNTERFEIT...or else Microplane has gone way downhill in quality
customer_reviews.text: I had a (genuine) Microplane that lasted for many, many years but finally got dull. This "Microplane" came without a sheath and was dull from the get-go. My dull old one is actually sharper than this. I should have been suspicious when it came without a sheath.
customer_reviews.author: Atlanta Family

customer_reviews.title: Quality control, anyone?
customer_reviews.text: This is the third Microplane I have purchased. The first one had a long, zesty life and eventually dulled. I replaced it with an open-box purchase from Amazon. Within days the handle fell off. I shrugged this off and purchased this new replacement. The good news is the handle hasn't fallen off, but the grater itself is defective - it's as if it has been flattened and it won't "catch" what's being grated. It's virtually useless to the point that I'm now using the one without a handle.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. Durable.
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to use and the product is just as good as it looks. The handle is thick and durable and the blades are strong and sharp. Perfect for grating Parmesan cheese. The length is long enough so that it takes less amount of work to go back and forth grating. This would make a good house warming gift. It also comes with a plastic hard case that you slide between the blades edges to prevent it from getting caught on anything. 100% customer satisfaction from me.
customer_reviews.author: Christal

customer_reviews.title: Counterfeit
customer_reviews.text: I must have gotten a counterfeit product because otherwise I can’t explain the other high reviews. This thing does not zest. I cannot get anything from a lime or lemon. With garlic and ginger if I press hard about I can but it’s very dangerous to my fingers since I have to be so rough with it. Very disappointed as this is not the first counterfeit item I have gotten from amazon
customer_reviews.author: Jessica M. Ingraham

customer_reviews.title: The handle came completely off the zester after a few ...
customer_reviews.text: The handle came completely off the zester after a few uses. I still use it I am just very careful as there are very sharp edges. My husband tried for hours to get the handle back on, but to no avail
customer_reviews.author: king

customer_reviews.title: It does the job well
customer_reviews.text: I bought the grater to use on a variety of things: lemon peel, cheese, onions, etc. The substantial handle balances it well, so that a potentially hazardous tool is totally safe to use. I like the long working end: it makes short shrift of the task. And it does the job well! In all, a well-designed tool that I enjoy using.
customer_reviews.author: Pearl

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for heels and calluses.  Everything else is for sissies.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for heels. I'm not joking. This thing has never seen the inside of my kitchen. I keep it in the bathroom. It saves my heels from calluses and dry skin during summer. I've tried everything for my poor war torn feet and this is the only thing that works. I live in a city, and easily walk a good couple of cement laden miles every day. I teach, so I'm on my feet a good 6-8 hours every day. Pedegg? Ha. That's for sissies. Pumice stone? Child's play. This is the real deal.
customer_reviews.author: Edith

customer_reviews.title: Must have for zesting.
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion this is the best thing for zesting anything. Works phenomenally. I like the little plastic cover it came with to as it prevents me from zesting my knuckles reaching in the drawer. My only complaint is it is a little difficult to clean due to the edges on the bottom curving in. Other than that minor thing it is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied, results were as expected.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in February 2015 and forgot about it. I finally used it today and I am satisfied. I have huge graters (you know those with four sides) and I'm not happy with the bulkiness of those items. This thin microplane doesn't take up much needed kitchen workspace and is sharp enough to do the job. It doesn't strain your hand while trying to hold it in place when zesting, unlike those huge ones. Tried it with lemon and onions. You just need a quick swipe with a thin spatula/ bread knife to take the zest out of this gadget and into your bowl.
customer_reviews.author: LenTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Every kitchen needs this tool- makes life so much simpler.
customer_reviews.text: Every kitchen should have one of these- misplaced my other one so replaced it and still works like a dream. I use mine to grate nutmeg and for all citrus zesting. Do not recommend automatic dishwashing- I believe the dishwasher will dull the blades. Just a quick rinse and wipe backwards on the blades and let it dry- I also keep the blade guard on mine when not it use so I do not rasp my hands while reaching for another tool. I use it at least 5 times a week and expect it to last forever.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn K. Sweet

customer_reviews.title: Great for Parmesan and zest.
customer_reviews.text: Great for Parmesan and zest. I use this a lot, after a few years it is still rust free, unlike my other grater. I use a lot of lemon zest, this works well for that; the trick is to rub the lemon diagonally across the surface so you don't get long strands of zest. This allows you to get just the zest without any of the bitter pith. Cleaning just requires running it under the faucet, maybe a wipe with a sponge.
customer_reviews.author: Author Unknown

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing tool for the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this on 12/6/16 and again on 2/14/18 for a gift. The one I ordered first came with the sheath. the 2nd one I ordered did not. Why? I am returning this one because it is missing. If I order again will it come with a sheath? It is necessary to keep the blades sharp and not hurt yourself when searching for the tool in a drawer. This is an amazing tool for the kitchen! I love it!
customer_reviews.author: M. Lansford

customer_reviews.title: Buy this on it's own or in tandem with the Chef'n FreshForce Citrus Juicer.
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use, to clean. A must have. Your lemon peels will never again go to waste because it was a bother to drag out the standard grater, or peeling and chopping. With this microplane, not only is it easy to judge just how much zest to use, the zest itself is more flavorful due to the proper consistency. Of course, it's also useful for things like nutmeg, etc. The foods you are preparing will surely be enhanced with one or two easy swipes of lemon (for zest). A great compliment to the other must have: Chef'n FreshForce Citrus Juicer (also available via Amazon). ... I've purchased this combo as a gift for fellow cooks and they've loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Kitt

customer_reviews.title: Not a real Microplane
customer_reviews.text: There is no Microplane branding on this and it's terrible. I don't know why this has so many good reviews, they can't be real.
customer_reviews.author: LMC

customer_reviews.title: Why did they change the handle?
customer_reviews.text: I love Microplane graters, they work like champs, are dang near indispensable for SO many kitchen tasks, and they last forever with some thoughtful care. The last one I had was stolen, so I replaced it with this one, and what keeps me from giving it the 5 stars my last one got is the handle. My last one had a slightly grippy, rubberized handle that was comfortable to the hand. This one has a hard plastic handle, which is slippery. Not sure if Microplane changed it or if it's not the real deal, but I wish that it had the old, non-slip handle.
customer_reviews.author: J. Marriott

customer_reviews.title: Great for cheese!
customer_reviews.text: Compared to my old shredder this does a much better job, both by the finer shreds which mix in with food better, and it takes a lot less effort than my old shredder. The microplane just plain works better in my opinion. It comes with a sturdy plastic guard you can keep it in to prevent accidental cuts or damage to the blades. My one minor complaint is the handle can be a bit slippery at times.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Have hard dead skin at the bottom of your feet? This product is for you!
customer_reviews.text: Great for shaving the hard dead skin off the bottom of my feet! My heels have never felt so smooth! Don't tell the wife! I guess it works great for zesting lemons/oranges and grating ginger and nutmeg too. Now that I think of it desserts have been tasting weird as of late...
customer_reviews.author: Windir19

customer_reviews.title: Critical if you love cooking
customer_reviews.text: This particular one was a gift for my grandson as he's just setting up his kitchen and likes to cook. He wants a lot of my recipes and my microplane is almost indispensable for my recipes such as zesting (rasping) orange rinds, fresh ginger, garlic cloves and such. Nothing like starting young cooks out right!
customer_reviews.author: Marcella

customer_reviews.title: Its huge size isn't a plus.
customer_reviews.text: It's super sharp & grates very fine. I have no idea why it's a foot long. This makes it difficult to store, clean, & increases the likelihood you'll cut yourself or something else you didn't intend. The grating surface wraps around, so it's kind of a short U shape, which isn't ideal to get at the underside. It has a huge sheath that's hard to use. The handle is big & chunky. For all the materials used to make this, I would rather this item 1/3 the size. This one's in the "outgoing" pile. I replaced it with a flat, wide grating surface that's easy to get the stuff stuck underneath (maybe it's OXO brand?)
customer_reviews.author: Sharon K

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for zesting citrus and grating hard cheese
customer_reviews.text: Love this for zesting citrus and grating cheese! Also comes with a cover so you don’t inadvertently grate your fingers when digging for it in your kitchen drawer. Easy to clean, just rinse right after use and give a light once over with a soapy sponge. Haven’t used for garlic or ginger yet but I’m sure would work wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: Cherlyn

customer_reviews.title: Great company
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these years ago and use it numerous times per week. It is still sharp and the blade is amazing for citrus, hard cheeses, spices, etc. Last week while granting a hard cheese the blade bent about 40 degrees. I contacted the warranty email address from them website and they sent me a new one even quicker than they said they would. Fantastic company that stands by their products.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: It's more than a normal grater or the fine holes on a box grater
customer_reviews.text: A must-have kitchen tool. My roommates had almost everything but were missing ice cube trays (how did they not have these?) and a microplane--I promptly brought both. It's razor sharp and makes light work of zesting citrus, grating hard cheese, and "mincing" ginger or garlic. It's more than a normal grater or the fine holes on a box grater, and well worth having. Cleans easily with soap, hot water, and a brush. I believe it's also dishwasher safe, but it's pretty easy to hand wash.
customer_reviews.author: cacj77

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS THING. I use it to grate ginger, garlic, herbs, spice, vegetables, you name it. It does "grate" with zesting and mincing as well. It is a little difficult to clean but I can usually get most of the residue off with just water. I haven't seen any rust/oxidation on the metal portion yet and I use/wash this sucker fairly often. The only caution I have is that the grate is a little long for my purposes some times. Other than that, it's a wonderful tool and "grate" addition to my kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: The microplane 40020 is perfect for the daily cook in your house!
customer_reviews.text: Gave this as a gift for my daughter who complained about how awful it was to use the small part of her cheese grater. She said it was a lot of work with little results. After researching which gadget out there was best for her needs it was clear it was this micro plane 40020. I was right. She loves everything about it and has been happily using it ever since!
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Colasuonno

customer_reviews.title: Great zester
customer_reviews.text: Easy to hold, use, and clean. America's Test Kitchen is generally going to give you THE advice, and when I read that they had recommended this one, I bought it immediately. Who knows how sharp the teeth will be in a year or 3, but it's everything I want and need today! Does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: SFO Bro

customer_reviews.title: Important info
customer_reviews.text: Be aware when you purchase that Microplane is a brand, not a generic term. Make certain you are receiving a genuine Microplane, which is a wonderful addition to your kitchen or gift for a bride. I feel that a few of the negative reviews were because customers ordered and receiving another brand, thinking that Microplane is a generic description, like 'kleenex' is for facial tissues, not so. Free shipping and less than posted price might be a clue for this.
customer_reviews.author: Nanci C. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Microplane 40020 Classic Zester/Grater - we love it
customer_reviews.text: This is a serious grater/zester. Not like your traditional graters. Not like your traditional zesters. "Looped" teeth, I think that's the way to describe it, takes a bite out of anything that rakes across it (including fingers and knuckles). The shape is perfect for fresh nutmeg, ginger, garlic, parmesan cheese, lemons or limes. I does better with the dryer ingredients though, because the moister ones will stick to the back somewhat. The length is long enough to fit into or over bowl edges. Cleaning is easy with a rinse sprayer. Exercise caution when using and have fun!
customer_reviews.author: CK in VA

customer_reviews.title: Didn't stay sharp
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for the first year or two. Over time, it became duller. After 6 years it is pretty useless. I use it solely for grating ginger, and no more than once per month. There are a lot of similar graters, so I will replace with another rather than repurchase this version.
customer_reviews.author: E. Derzawiec

customer_reviews.title: The blade seems to work like you would expect from a microplane zester which is ...
customer_reviews.text: This microplane product is not the same quality as I have seen from other retailers in this price range. The blade seems to work like you would expect from a microplane zester which is why I gave it more than 1 star. However the handle is a hard plastic (as opposed to the rubber handle which I was expecting), which is not very comfortable to hold and does not have the best grip. There was also no cover which can be an issue for storage and can damage other items. I ended up returning.
customer_reviews.author: Asheley

customer_reviews.title: Really sharp!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't actually used this to zest something for a recipe, but I think it will be superb when I do. I tried it on the side of a lemon, and it ate right through the skin easily. The little bumps are so sharp that I store the piece inside the cardboard cover. Wouldn't feel good dragged over one's skin.
customer_reviews.author: Florence May

customer_reviews.title: I wish there was an easier way to grate ginger.
customer_reviews.text: This appears to be a great zester. Unfortunately, I have never used it as such. I have only used this grater for ginger. It is fairly easy to use. Just need to be extra careful not to cut yourself. Additionally, it is a little hard to clean. It takes sometimes several minutes to get the stringy ginger out of this thing. Still, my love for grated ginger empowers me to continue to use this thing. I wish there was an easier to way to grate ginger.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Nakamura

customer_reviews.title: It is probably sharp enough for most things you would want to shred
customer_reviews.text: I use it for ginger root (no need to peel either, just wash before grating) & lemon zest also wash first. I make asian dishes & tea with the grated ginger root, so much better than chopping! I grate directly into the pot for coking, it is easy to balance the long grater over the pot & let the shreds fall down. Highly recommend rinsing immediately after use, after 10 minutes it is much harder to get out food of the holes. Noce storage sleeve keeps it protected & your fingers if you keep it in a mixed drawer like me.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last
customer_reviews.text: Granted, I bought this in 2015, but I rarely have used it. Right now, only about an inch at the handle end will grate. I can rub the top 8" over a lemon with no results. Can anyone suggest a reasonably priced zester that will last, please?
customer_reviews.author: K. Worthington

customer_reviews.title: you'll have a grater (very very fine, not a replacement for the standard size graters
customer_reviews.text: I've used this zester/grater for years. I lost mine in a move recently and had to buy another. For the price, you'll have a grater (very very fine, not a replacement for the standard size graters, but fun for parmesan garnishes for example) that will stay sharp for years and effectively zest fruit every day. It's also quite easy to clean as long as you don't grate your sponge by forgetting which way the 'grain' goes.
customer_reviews.author: David R

customer_reviews.title: Where have you been all my life?
customer_reviews.text: I love this! If your recipes frequently call for citrus zest, this microplane is something you need to have. The zesters I've had in the past were cumbersome. I ended up with more zest on my hands and on the tool, than in the bowl. Clean up is a little awkward, but that is to be expected. I imagine you can use this to grate nutmeg, ginger, and create chocolate shavings.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Love love love!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS THING! I had an old bar zesting tool that was a hassle to zest with. Took forever too. When I got this it was amazing. Super fast and easy to zest, no mess on my hands, easy to hold and position and I got a much finer zest. I don’t dread zesting anymore haha
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love it. I gave it three stars because the ...
customer_reviews.text: Zester is sharp and works very well. I love it. I gave it three stars because the first time I used it the black handle just came off! I am convinced I can get it back on, though have not had success yet. You can still use the zester, just not quite as comfortable on the hands. But apart from the handle coming off, this is a great tool. Takes just the zest off and leaves the white pith. Do use caution, however, as it is, as I have stated, very sharp! I am sure I could have gotten in contact with the company and gotten a replacement, but just haven't done it.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: but have yet to find one I like better than this one
customer_reviews.text: I have tried other zesters, but have yet to find one I like better than this one. It doesn't "drag" or get hung up when zesting lemons. I even purchased a more expensive one thinking it would be better. It was not. I'll stick with this one from now on.
customer_reviews.author: C.F. in GA

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality, Works Well, Easy to Clean
customer_reviews.text: Who knew I even needed a zester?? I always just used a cheese grater, but decided to give this a try as I've started cooking more lately with fresh ingredients. It came packaged with a hard plastic cover that I expect you might use for storage, although I didn't bother with it. As for performance, this beats the heck out of the cheese grater- you get so much more zest from a single piece of fruit! It's also way easier to clean. I rinse it off right after I use it and wipe with a soapy scrubber or sometimes throw in the dishwasher. It's still
customer_reviews.author: H. Bush

customer_reviews.title: THE ZEST!
customer_reviews.text: So many neighbors borrow our zester, we decided to purchase another for our own use. The best zester we've ever used. Also makes a terrific stocking stuffer.
customer_reviews.author: Shar More

customer_reviews.title: every time I was in a kitchen store and asked for a hand grater they looked at me like I was nuts
customer_reviews.text: I have watched all the chef's use this for years, every time I was in a kitchen store and asked for a hand grater they looked at me like I was nuts. I looked all over and so did the clerks. Well, it's called a Microplane. It is so easy, so cool, so simple to use and does a fast accurate job, a sinch to clean out lemon zest, on top only scrape the zest toward the top, on the back side go either way. So cool. Wanna clean it stick in water, rinse done. Ps. Very Sharp a great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Need Replacement
customer_reviews.text: I used this product for a couple of days and it worked great and while grating some pecorino romano cheese the blade pulled away and out from the handle. As far as I can tell there’s no way to put it back together. Is there a way I can get a replacement?
customer_reviews.author: Mike C

customer_reviews.title: Useful tool, but you don't really need it.
customer_reviews.text: I only use it for parmesan cheese or zesting fruit(orange, lemon) maybe for hard chocolate once or twice so It's mostly sitting in the drawer. I still like how useful it is. When I saw it on TV I wanted to have one myself. I don't regret it at all. I also don't think it's necessary to have one for everybody. you could easily use any other fine greater instead of this one. Otherwise fine product.
customer_reviews.author: cagatay seyhan

customer_reviews.title: An absolute ESSENTIAL
customer_reviews.text: When you find yourself going out of your way to prepare foods that include citrus zest and minced garlic, you know you've stumbled upon something special. I do not know how I lived my life without this zester. I have about a half-dozen other alternative gadgets I've employed forever to merely approximate the amazingly easy, safe, comfortable and excellent results I've gotten from this one tool. Sleek enough to store easily virtually anywhere it will be handy, this microplane cleans up VERY easily with no picking and begging, which is surprising for something so tightly engineered that you barely even run the risk of scraping a nail when you're not being (in this product's case, unnecessarily) careful.
customer_reviews.author: CAS MARINO

customer_reviews.title: Not that great
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this product as it is a curved planer and takes longer to use. The refund policy is terrible. Only receiving $4.51 refund on a return of a new item!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best tool I never knew I needed
customer_reviews.text: After trying to use box graters for zest and hard cheeses for so long, this was a welcome edition to my kitchen. I can grate Parmeggiano-Reggiano in less than half the time it used to take. Zesting is similarly quick. I also like that this is easier to clean. I haven't tried it with a soft cheese like cheddar, as I imagine that wouldn't go over to well. However, if you need to zest or grate harder objects more than two or three times a year, this is a must own. It takes up so little space, and pays for itself quickly in saved time and effort.
customer_reviews.author: R. George

customer_reviews.title: Many years of use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this grater 10 years ago and have been very satisfied. We usually use it for grating hard cheese over pasta. At some point the edge got a bit bent in one section, but this has not affected it's use. I now store it in an old wooden knife block in a slot meant for a sharpener, and this has kept the grater handy and in good condition since. I wash it in the dishwasher top rack and have had no problems. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Maui Wahine

customer_reviews.title: ... so well I am still trying to find the best way to use it without mincemeating my thumb
customer_reviews.text: It works so well I am still trying to find the best way to use it without mincemeating my thumb. I have only tried it on hard cheeses, like Reggiano, but I think it will be great for zesting citrus as well as my other tiny graters are not aggressive enough. Cleaning: I let the minute cheese residue dry for a couple hours and it just flakes right out. Did not even need to wash it the last time. Anxious to try on garlic next. If it were 1/2 inch or more wider the food might stay centered on the grater... that's where my thumb comes into play. I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Zama

customer_reviews.title: Great kitchen tool
customer_reviews.text: This Microplane 40020 Classic Zester/Grater is a "grate" tool. (Sorry couldn't stop myself). I lemons by the bag, bring them home and juice & zest them and put both in the freezer to use as needed. This thing is great! It's easy to hold and use and is very sharp. Be careful using it! As much as I've used it, it still as sharp as the day I got it. It quickly became one of my most used kitchen tools I consider it a necessity now. It comes with a clear plastic cover and I suggest you use it when you store it I highly recommend this tool.
customer_reviews.author: K.O.

customer_reviews.title: as I already have one and it has become one of my favorite go-to items in the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a present, as I already have one and it has become one of my favorite go-to items in the kitchen. I use it on citrus peels, but it also makes short work of parmesan cheese, chocolate, and other cheeses. I make sure to always put it back into its sheath, as it has stayed sharp over a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah L Shank

customer_reviews.title: quality product
customer_reviews.text: This impressive microplane came perfectly packed in a protective cover. Thank goodness it came with a guard because it is extremely sharp. I purchased it in black but I have seen it in several other colors for a slightly higher price at a certain fancy kitchen store that has the word table in it. I am very impressed with the quality and how sturdy it feels in my hand. This is the exact one they use on Food Network, more precisely on the show Ch*p*ed. I have used it to zest fruits so far and it works like a charm. My only complaint is that I wish it was easier to clean, but that's just how microplanes are.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth McCumber

customer_reviews.title: Get this microplane!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great microplane. It works great for both Parmesan and zesting citrus. It is very easy to clean. It comes in a heavy plastic sheath, and I recommend storing it in the sheath.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Flyer

customer_reviews.title: Not a microplane product
customer_reviews.text: Cheap knockoff. Hard plastic handle. Not as pictured. Probably a $2 AliExpress item.
customer_reviews.author: M. Witt

customer_reviews.title: Makes life a little easier
customer_reviews.text: Life's so much easier with the right tools. I've had this zester/grater for a couple of years and it is still going strong. I've mainly used it to zest citrus peel and to grate parmesan cheese. Previously I used pre-grated parmesan, now that I have this grater I buy whole blocks of parmesan and my meals are much tastier. Two years later, I am still satisfied with this purchase.​
customer_reviews.author: Sam S

customer_reviews.title: A must-have in the kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: Love this grater/zester! I cook every day and this tool makes the job a lot easier. It comes with a protective sleeve so that was a nice bonus. It is very sharp and allows me to grate/zest things so much faster than my old box grater. A must-have in every kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: JLbeauTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: So grateful to own this...GET IT?! Grateful?!
customer_reviews.text: So you're thinking...do I really need another kitchen utensil? Yes, yes you do. This thing is amazing at grating anything from parmesan cheese, to chocolate for cocoa, to ginger for headache relieving tea and the list goes on and on and on. And! If your hand slips, it's a pro at shredding finger nails and skin alike - so be careful! It's lightweight, easy to handle even in small hands, fits well in the dishwasher and its little sleeve keeps going and going. Even a few years in to owning one we use it several times a week and it's a valued member of our kitchen family.
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen H.

customer_reviews.title: So much better than a box grater!
customer_reviews.text: So much better than a box grater! Grates quickly and easily, and is simple to clean. Works well on both cheese and citrus peels. I have bought two now--one for me, and one for my mother. When I moved out, she didn't want to let it go!
customer_reviews.author: I.R.M.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Microplane.

customer_reviews.text: Easily grates and zest’s whatever I need (anything from zucchini to a lemon) it is also fairly easy to clean, which I was pleasantly surprised by! It comes with a cover for the sharp side so you don’t accidentally cut yourself when reaching inside your drawer to grab it!
customer_reviews.author: Grace Kwon

customer_reviews.title: Great.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is GRATE. (I'm sorry. Just buy it. It's awesome.) This thing runs through the dishwasher (I keep it on the top shelf to be safe) and holds up well. It's lightweight, easy to store, and the grip is really nice. I'm not much of a cook, but this thing makes me look like I am in the kitchen. More than anything, I like it's size. It's slim enough to fit in your cutlery drawer and not be too intrusive.
customer_reviews.author: AS

customer_reviews.title: Super
customer_reviews.text: Great zested. Be careful though. It is very sharp. It comes with a plastic sheath to cover when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, very versatile
customer_reviews.text: Recently I started cooking more recipes that required a zester. There are a few ways to do this without a zester, and all of those ways are time consuming and terrible. Enter the Microplane. This is amazing. I use it for so much more than zesting. I use it to mince garlic. I use it to shred cheese. It is a wonderful, versatile tool. It comes with a little plastic cover to keep it sharp, and to protect yourself. It looks like a high quality tool/utensil for the kitchen. Get one, you will not regret it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kang

customer_reviews.title: Suprised to see some low ratings here
customer_reviews.text: I've had this grater for going on 10 years, and mine is still in perfect working condition. I hope that Microplane hasn't somehow cheapened this item. I use mine for grating citrus zest, nutmeg, garlic, and hard cheeses, and it produces perfect results every time. Try grating garlic on it especially--it produces a beautiful puree in seconds and the results are superior to what diligent knife work can produce in several minutes. I use this grater four or five times a week, and have been for years, with no deterioration in performance.
customer_reviews.author: curious cook

customer_reviews.title: I recommend
customer_reviews.text: I own and have purchased multiple Microplane for myself and as gifts. The name brand has been consistent over the years and I think every household should own at least one for zesting, quick cheese grating, great for nutmeg etc. Easy storage and has a nice cover to protect you and it while in the drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Just another Consumer :-)

customer_reviews.title: A must have for anyone who cooks!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best tools you can have in the kitchen. Don't let that citrus zest go to waste ! So much flavor and vitamins get left behind in the zest- you can even dry it and sprinkle it in your dishes as you please! Also use this to mince garlic, easier than a garlic press, easier cleanup, and one less tool you need in your kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Samuelson

customer_reviews.title: Great Zester , gives you control where your gratings/zest fall.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this thing non stop in the kitchen since I got it. I don't know how I lived without it. It does a nice job of cleanly grating parmesan cheese or making lemon zest without getting it all over the place. Seriously with this thing you can control where the grated material lands pretty well so you don't make a mess. And its top shelf dishwasher safe and pretty durable feeling.
customer_reviews.author: Another Bloke2

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but could be grater.
customer_reviews.text: I have no complaints about its functionality -- it works great. That said, after about a year and a half it has started to rust where the grater meets handle. As it turns out, "surgical stainless steel" is basically a meaningless, throwaway term that can be applied to pretty much any grade of stainless steel. Live and learn, I guess.

customer_reviews.title: superb tool

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice for fine grating
customer_reviews.text: I saw several graters reviewed on America's Test Kitchen and this was like the one they recommended. I've used it for citrus and cheese already and I like it very much. The only slight complaint is that you need to be careful when cleaning it, but that's not really a problem. I'm happy I bought it.

customer_reviews.title: NOT RUST PROOF

customer_reviews.title: Getting the prefect zest
customer_reviews.text: This microplane makes the finest zest of lemons, limes,, It grates nutmeg to a smoothness that is almost a fine powder Really nice.

customer_reviews.title: Good, solid, and SHARP
customer_reviews.text: Much better to use than everything else I've tried. Do wish it had a broader hilt guard for my hand but it's sharp enough to not have much drag. That being said...clean with a bottle washer. The channels are small for fingers and sharp. It has done a beautiful job for the month that I've had it.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Fine grating and zesting
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. It does Parmesan so that it is feathery light and melts on contact. It does fresh ginger very fine. It zests citrus very nicely. It is not as fancy as others I have seen with more contoured handles and stops on the bottom but I have really enjoyed it. I've had it a year now and still works great.
customer_reviews.author: Pattie

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite kitchen tools.
customer_reviews.text: I had wanted one of these grater for years. When I finally received mine in the mail, I grabbed a lemon and took off every bit of zest off of it. Hard cheeses, easy. Citrus zest, easy. And adding grated zest upped my baking and sauce game. Dark chocolate, done. Cotija cheese, falls like snow on my tacos. If you’re in the fence about getting one, jump.
customer_reviews.author: Karla

customer_reviews.title: Great price and high quality.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t think you could get a better for the price. It’s very sharp and a good size (so far used for lemons and on Parmesan). It has a plastic cover over the blades that I kept to store in my drawers.
customer_reviews.author: rycb

customer_reviews.title: Microplane 40020 Classic Zester/Grater,
customer_reviews.text: This zester is outstanding! Slides easily and, for some reason, there appears to be more zest than my previous one. Easy to wash.
customer_reviews.author: GW

customer_reviews.title: Fake product, counterfeit.
customer_reviews.text: Received a knock-off version. Buyer beware, this is not a real product.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: You NEED a microplane
customer_reviews.text: I'm a no clutter kind of guy in the kitchen. If I don't use something, it ends up gone... but a microplane grater will NEVER be absent from my kitchen again. These graters are a billion times better than any other brand. They use a special manufacturing process that etches the holes in the blade rather than punching them, which leads to a stronger, sharper edge. The result? This thing will breeze through difficult to grate items with almost no effort. I use mine mostly for parmigiana cheese and whole nutmeg, but I have also found it incredibly useful for grating those fibrous ginger roots.
customer_reviews.author: Yakbeard

customer_reviews.title: Works well but the handle feels cheap
customer_reviews.text: This is a good zester but the handle is really light/cheap feeling plastic. It does the job but I thought it would have more heft.
customer_reviews.author: JorgeH26

customer_reviews.title: Great Zester
customer_reviews.text: This Zester was a gift for my granddaughter but I have one just like it and love it. My cousin gave mine to me showing me how to use it best by turning the open side up and running the underside over the item you are removing zest from. This keeps all the zest inside the grater until you are ready to empty. Whenever I see it being using on TV they use the opposite side and I think they should know my cousin's instructions for a cleaner zest. Amazon Prime lets me order little things like this at no shipping to add to my granddaughter's new interest in cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia H. Barker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Citrus and Hard Cheeses
customer_reviews.text: This excellent tool takes off just the right amount when used to zest citrus, and grates hard cheeses like Parmesan and Cotija so finely that the grated cheese looks almost like a little drift of snow. It does need to be hand washed, but fortunately this can be done quickly. I find using a brush with bristles helps me to get it clean without risk to my fingers--it is very sharp! It comes with a protective sheath that allows you to store it without worrying about grating your fingers when you are rummaging through your cooking tools. I used to try to zest citrus with a regular grater. Now that I have this, I will never go back.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Love this tool.

customer_reviews.title: and Parmesan easily. My particular cover only fits from one side
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting a "Microplane" and was pleasantly surprise to find that this a genuine Microplane. It zests, grates garlic, nutmeg, and Parmesan easily. My particular cover only fits from one side, and only if you squeeze the 'scrolls' together before sliding the rasp in. But it protects both the Microplane and everything in the drawer around it, so I'll take that minor annoyance.
customer_reviews.author: Lyn Young

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic tool. Everyone should get one!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic Microplane/rasp! I have tried many different graters and rasps attempting to easy lemon zest, grated ginger etc. Most have raised grating edges making for ragged fingernails, abbrated knuckles, half the ingredient stuck in the grater instead of in my food and extremely difficult cleaning. This tool is different. Its quite sturdy, yet I can run my fingers back along the grating surface and I'm completely unscarred. And best of all, everything gets into my recipe! Thank you Microplane, you've made a customer for life!
customer_reviews.author: Jupitermynx

customer_reviews.title: Nicely sharp, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: We use this grater mainly for nutmeg but also for lemon peel and other miscellaneous tasks where we want a very fine grind. It is nice and sharp so it makes grating quick and easy, but is also much easier to clean than the combination box graters I have used before. Just quickly run the dishcloth along the grater with the grain front and back, and you're done. It comes with a plastic sheath to protect it in storage, so you don't have to worry about tossing it in the kitchen drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Izzy Brick

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: I really like this mirco plane zester. It makes quick work on limes or even on parmesan. Easy clean up
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for grating nutmeg and zesting citrus.
customer_reviews.text: This will last longer if you grate one direction and not push down the pucker. These metal heads will flatten out over time if you grate "back and forth" on the grate and will render this product useless over time.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This microplane is very sturdy, and the protective sheath is a nice bonus that works to protect the grates and your fingers when reaching in the kitchen drawer. I've used this for nutmeg and hard cheeses, and it works really well.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Best microplane grater/zester
customer_reviews.text: I love this grater/zester. I've been baking a lot lately, tyying new recipes that call for lemon/lime zest. This product fit the bill. It was easy to hold and you could zest right into the bowl. Worth the money.

customer_reviews.title: I never imagined that zesting could be fun. I swear this device is magic
customer_reviews.text: I never imagined that zesting could be fun. I swear this device is magic. How it managed to not get any of the white part of the rind will always be a mystery to me but it only gets the part of the rind you want no matter how often you go over the same spot. It is easy to use, easy to clean and an incredible time saver.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great zester at a great price

customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Works great!  Really glad I got this!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted one for along time and was using a normal cheese grater as a zester. I finally decided to splurge and get this after a recipe I had needed a good amount of lemon zest. Wow, was I glad I did! It works so much better than trying to get zest another way, and the way this thing "collects" the zest underneath allows you to really judge and control the amount you add to your recipe. I love it, it was a very good purchase!

customer_reviews.title: There's better, but it works.

customer_reviews.author: John in KCMO

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little zester/grater!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I love, LOVE this little zester! It works wonderfully on citrus as well as nutmeg, chocolate, cinnamon, and hard cheese. No effort involved. Nice and smooth. Everything seems fluffy, if that's really a good word to use. I guess the grater is so sharp, that anything that you zest/grate, doesn't need to be pushed hard...a nice, even, light pressure does the trick so the result is a lighter, fluffier pile of whatever you've used it on. Highly recommend this zester/grater!
customer_reviews.author: ~purplemoon~

customer_reviews.title: Changed my life!
customer_reviews.text: I really thought a grater did a good enough job zesting lemons but after seeing this in use by so many home cooks and chefs on TV, I decided to get one. It has changed my life! Now making lemon raspberry and lemon poppyseed muffins for my family just got a whole lot easier.
customer_reviews.author: Shari

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I never thought I'd care about a grater but I love this one! I bought it so that I could hold it & grate parmesan cheese over pasta. I was afraid that would be too difficult to do but it works great. It's very easy to hold. The teeth are very sharp and the cheese grates into beautiful little curls. I highly recommend this grater. It's easy to clean and comes with an acrylic protective cover. We also bought it for zesting but haven't gotten around to that, yet. Microplane also makes a box grater that is supposed to be really good but it's pricey. Still, I plan to buy one soon.
customer_reviews.author: acls
